br.com.caelum.vraptor.environment

Interface Environment

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultEnvironment, ServletBasedEnvironment

    public interface Environment
    An environment has a set of key/value properties to be used within your application
    Author:
    Alexandre Atoji, Guilherme Silveira

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String get(java.lang.String string)
      Returns a key
      java.lang.String get(java.lang.String string, java.lang.String defaultValue)
      Returns a key or a default value if the value isn't set
      java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> getKeys() 
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the environment name
      java.net.URL getResource(java.lang.String name)
      Locates a resource according to your current environment.
      boolean has(java.lang.String key)
      Checks if a key is present
      boolean isDevelopment()
      an alias to Environment#supports(DEVELOPMENT)
      boolean isProduction()
      an alias to Environment#supports(PRODUCTION)
      boolean isTest()
      an alias to Environment#supports(TEST)
      void set(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      Sets a key in memory.
      boolean supports(java.lang.String feature)
      Checks if a key is equals to true if it's not present will return false

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the environment name

      • has

        boolean has(java.lang.String key)
        Checks if a key is present

      • supports

        boolean supports(java.lang.String feature)
        Checks if a key is equals to true if it's not present will return false

        java.lang.String get(java.lang.String string)
        Returns a key

      • get

        java.lang.String get(java.lang.String string,
                   java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Returns a key or a default value if the value isn't set

      • set

        void set(java.lang.String key,
       java.lang.String value)
        Sets a key in memory. This will *not* affect any configuration file.

      • getKeys

        Returns:
        an Iterable with all keys
